Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, both the interior and exterior are covered with a red-brown burnished slip, with remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the interior and a further six lines on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394637) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394637)
